name: Red Riding Hood Wednesday 18th Dec. 7.30pm
description: A Christmas return to the Boo of our own favourite. A gorgeously rendered re-telling of the classic girl-and-wolf tale. Exquisite visuals blend with pantomime-style silliness and spooky moments to create and enchanting piece of theatre ideal for all over the age of 4.

name: Cake Sunday 2nd Feb 3pm
description:
Cake takes to the kitchen to re-tell the familiar story of St George and the Dragon in a manner that keeps the story as fresh as lemon scented washing-up liquid. 
Our hero travels through forests of forks and mountains of washing-up to do battle with a vicious set of snapping teeth that threaten a large cake living inside it.

By Whalley Range All Stars who brought Pig and Compost Mentis.

Age 4+

name: Jack and the Beanstalk  WEDS 19th Feb 2pm
description:
Fee Fi Fo Fum! It's a giant of a show, we'd love you to come!
This classic fairy-tale now gets the Lyngo treatment so expect lots of surprises, a gripping story and beautiful images as Jack sells his cow for 5 magic beans and finds himself in the land above the clouds. It's a show for the over 3's (and their giants) with something for everyone - enormous shoes, tiny houses, showers of silver and gold and a big leafy explosion!

name: Tomten Sun 23rd March 3pm
description:
When all is quiet, when everyone is asleep, the Tomten wakes up. He looks after everyone on the farm. Sometimes, you can see his footprints in the snow. That's how you know he is real.
Viktor Rydberg's poem is brought to life in a great new puppetry show which will be a delight for children. Gentle and poignant, it is full of delightful farm characters and moments of great joy.

By Old Saw theatre
Age 3+

name: BLAST OFF! Sun 6th April 3pm
description:
The Noisy Animals are THE biggest band in the world. So big in fact, that there's nowhere on earth big enough for them to perform any more - they're about to BLAST OFF into outer space to find their new sound and to play a gig on the moon, broadcast live to the whole of planet earth.
What will they discover on their travels? Bring your rock-out costume because we're going in to space.


By Kid Carpet, for all ages

name: HOW COLD MY TOES Sun 4th May 3pm
description:
A whole year is packed into one enchanting hour in this brand new production. Devised in collaboration with dance company Champloo, the show takes you on a fun-filled magical journey through the seasons, from the seed-sprouting vitality of spring all the way to the frosty frozen fingers of winter.
Families and children of all ages will be captivated by the combination of our renowned brand of performance, music and design with amazing urban choreography.

By Travelling Light Theatre 
For all ages

name: THE MILLERS TALE THURS 8th May 7.30pm
description:
It's Chaucer as never before! A musical comedy told by England's oldest song and dance man, the Miller! 
These days he recites his poem, dances round his broomstick, sings the songs of Bob Dylan, and wears an interesting collection of hats.
"A highly original and inventive interpretation....Chaucer would have been delighted at Pete's inimitable wacky style and would have become an overnight fan of Bob Dylan"

By Pete Morton
Age 14+

name: PUPPET FESTIVAL    31st MAY-1st JUNE 2014!!!
description:
In 2014 we're holding this must -visit Festival earlier in the year. Included along with many, many other puppetry delights, are Theatre Rites' RUBBISH, the delightful Italian company La Baracca and Norwich Puppet Theatre's wonderful show for early years - 3 colours.
Plus all the other special events you've come to expect of the Puppet Festival - a wonderful cake café, lots of free walkabout events, outdoor shows and live music.

name: WHO'S BEEN SITTING IN MY CHAIR Sun 20th July 3pm
description:
Who indeed? One two three. Was it you or was it me? Or was it perhaps a small wee bear? Or was it the girl with the golden hair?
A playful and musical interpretation of a well known tale-with porridge and bears and one two three chairs. A tale that's not too big and not too small but just right. 
Spring in the air puts a spring in all our steps and one little girl is always a step ahead. And when small bear gets lost, we all have to go on a bear hunt! 
By Freehand Theatre Co.
Age 3+

name: The Silent Weaver: Roger Hutchinson
description:
The Silent Weaver is a rich, moving and enthralling exploration of mental health, the creative process, human frailty and ancient traditions, written by a prize-winning author. It tells the story of Angus MacPhee, the subject of Horse + Bamboo's new production 

Angus was a crofter from Uist, who went off to war in 1939 but was struck down by mental illness and he spent the next 50 years of his life in a psychiatric institution. During this time he chose not to speak, but he wove mysterious and wonderful garments made from the grass that grew in the hospital garden.

name: BrUNIMA MEMBERSHIP: GROUP
description: Group annual subscription for 2013. Includes membership of the International body and Associate Membership of PUK.

name: BrUNIMA MEMBERSHIP: INDIVIDUAL
description: Individual annual subscription for 2013. Includes membership of the International body and Associate Membership of PUK.

name: BrUNIMA MEMBERSHIP: STUDENT
description: Student annual subscription for 2013. Includes membership of the International body and Associate Membership of PUK.

name: Star Matter
description:
Star Matter is a fascinating book and one of the inspirations for "Deep Time Cabaret'. It offers ideas for developing an awareness and appreciation of where we’ve come from and where we’re going to. It discusses some of the bigger questions and explains concepts such as the origin of matter that even we humans are composed of. 

Star Matter contains pointers and suggestions for those wishing to apply these concepts to educating young people. A beautifully presented and illustrated book.

name: Veil CD
description:
The long awaited VEIL soundtrack composed by Loz Kaye. 

Veil captures the epic sweep of Horse + Bamboo's production - two continents - two generations divided by war, but bound together by fate. Loz Kaye's music spans these worlds exploring the thrilling sound of arabic music, but giving it a powerfully rhythmic contemporary setting. 

It features Loz on vocals, flutes, trumpet, keyboards, percussion and programming and arabic narration by Faliha Kadhim.

name: Veil CD + Book Combo
description:
Buy the VEIL book and CD for only £20!

"Veil is a huge step for visual theatre." THE STAGE

name: Veil Book
description:
A perfect book for students interested in visual and physical theatre. A beautifully produced and lavishly illustrated book that takes a journey through the production of 'Veil'. With sections on the writing of the piece, its making, rehearsal and design plus a lookat the artists notebooks and creative processes. 

Includes a special illustrated version of the Veil story by Andrea Fox.

Full-colour; hardback: 80pp. "Veil is a huge step for visual theatre" THE STAGE.

name: Mask Poster
description: A great A2 size poster showing 30 Horse + Bamboo masks. A really unusual poster that makes an excellent present. Comes in a card tube so can be wall mounted or framed without folds.

name: Horse + Bamboo anniversary picture book
description:
A 32-page A5 book with scores of full-colour illustrations about the work of the company.

This book was produced for the 25th Anniversary year of H+B but is still relevant today and gives an unsurpassed pictorial record of the history of H+B and its productions.

name: H+B giant poster book
description:
A unique A3 book of 10 original wood and lino-cut posters by Bob Frith. 

These hand-made posters were created specially for H+B events and tours, and were one of the 'trademarks' of the horse-drawn company.
